captions.text:
I was in a small airplane and
all of the sudden the engine
on the wing caught fire.

It exploded and burning oil was
poured all over the right

side of the airplane
and we started to
dive toward the earth.

We were spinning
down our death.

Oh, this woman across the
aisle, I just was
so sorry for her.

She was just absolutely
uncontrollably hysterical.
And I was calm.

I was totally calm, even though
I knew I was going down
to my death.
I was ready to meet my Maker.
We didn't crash.
We didn't die.

The spiral dive extinguished
the flame.

The pilot got control and
started the other engine up.

We made an emergency landing
out in a field.

But I thought, through that
experience, if you've got

faith, you can handle
difficulties knowing that with

any true perspective that
all will be well.

In Luke 21, "The Earth shall be
in distress, nations with

perplexity, the seas and
the waves roaring.

Men's hearts failing them for
fear." What we're seeing is a

prediction that in
these latter days
people will be afraid.

Men's hearts are failing, and
that includes women, because

they forget their identity
and their purpose.
The heartaches will come.

I've lived through the
death of a wife in
the death of a daughter.

I've seen the troubles
that divorce brings.

Children or grandchildren
go astray,
disability, illness, injuries.

For the individual who is weak
in the heart, fearful in the

heart, be patient
with yourself.

Perfection comes not in this
life, but in the next life.

Don't demand things that are
unreasonable, but demand of
yourself improvement.

As you let the Lord help you
through that, He will make the
difference.

I'm so grateful for the gospel
of Jesus Christ that allows me

that kind of strength in
these tumultuous times.

comments.text:
Elder Russell M. Nelson shares a personal story to give encouragement for 
when we feel “weak in the heart.” +Mormon Channel #Mormon #LDS #weakness﻿

comments.text: 這是約兩年前，耶穌基督後期聖徒教會十二使徒定額組羅素・納爾遜長老分享的短片，還不到三分鐘吧！不過一直滿令我感動的。看字幕翻譯的，應該不會很好，僅分享～有次我搭小飛機。突然，引擎起火，爆炸了。燃燒的油灑遍機身右側，我們開始往下掉。我們旋轉下墜，迎向死亡。坐在走道另側的女子，哦，我很難過，她驚慌得無法自己。而我是冷靜的。我當時完全地冷靜，即便我知道我就要死了。我準備要去見我的創造者了。(後來)我們沒有墜毀，我們沒有死。旋迴下降撲滅了火勢，機長重新控制飛機，並啟動了另一個引擎。我們迫降了。然而，我想經過那次的經驗...如果你有足夠的信心，你可以處理難關。知道以永恆的眼光來看，一切好。路加福音第21章說：地上的邦國也有困苦；因海中波浪的聲響，就慌慌不定。天勢都要震動，人想起那將要臨到世界的事，就都嚇得魂不附體。我們如今所見的，是在後期時代的徵兆。無論男女，人心慌慌不定，因為他們忘了他們的目的和身份。...生命中會有心痛。我從髮妻和女兒的逝去中走過。我看過離婚所帶來的困境。子女和孫子女不相往來。殘障。疾病。傷害。我想向每位心裡脆弱和害怕的朋友說：對自己要有耐心。完美不會在今生來到，但是會在永生來到。不要要求不合理的事情，但是要求改善你自己。當你讓主來帶領你經過這些時，祂會讓一切有所不同。我感謝耶穌基督的福音，在這些困難的時刻讓我堅強起來。﻿

comments.text:
It reminds me of the hymn "Where can I turn for peace." The verse that 
stands out to me in that song is Where can I turn for peace when other 
sources ceased to make me whole." This story of Elder Nelson is a great 
example, of how in trouble times, but also in times of sunshine, that we 
have the power of prayer to commune with our heavenly father. He is always 
ready to answers our prayers, we need to just communicate with him. I 
testify of that, in the name of Jesus Christ, Amen.

Religious beliefs are not the same as faith on the Lord. You have given a 
good example about suicide bombers. In the church members interchangeably

comments.author: DAPHNEY HENRY

comments.text:
I can assure you, I'm wide awake. And I don't trust my salvation to Joseph 
Smith even though I know him to be a prophet of God; I trust my salvation 
to the Lord. And I have read the New Testament and I do have a relationship 
with Christ. It is not as strong as it should be, but that is my fault and 
my fault alone.
comments.author: Sarah Nebeker

comments.text:
So if a mortal man commits an indiscretion then it discounts the word of 
God in the Bible and/or Book of Mormon? How do you even believe in Christ 
with all the child molesting, raping and adulterous pastors/priests/etc all 
over the world? I doubt the truth in your words. I trust what I find in my 
bible and Book of Mormon and the words of wise and good men after it. I 
believe in Christ and do my best to seek him. Stop listening to/preaching 
hate towards other people. Those hearts are not w/God
comments.author: MamaPojo

comments.text:
I don't think sharing your opinion is a buzz kill. And I admit as a young 
child I was afraid to die, but as I grew older (and I hope wiser), I came 
to realize that death is a part of life and we must all go through it. I've 
realized that I have no reason to fear death as long as I do my best in 
this life.
comments.author: Sarah Nebeker

comments.text:
I can honestly tell you, I'm wide awake. Joseph Smith does not hold my 
salvation in his hands. He helped restore the truth and I believe he set a 
Christ-like example even though he made mistakes as we all do. I've been 
thoroughly studying the NT and it has only strengthened my testimony that 
this is the true gospel. And these disciples encourage me to have a 
personal relationship with Christ. Granted, I'm not perfect at being like 
Him, but I'm trying and I've had personal conversations with Him.
comments.author: Sarah Nebeker

comments.text: The video that lies closest to me heart
comments.author: Smiggles van dort

comments.text:
Elder Utchdorf once explained an experiment that was made with 2 groups of 
people. Both had to go through a forest to it's other side but they were 
given no compass or a map, but they had references to guide themselves. 1 
group kept going in circles and the other managed to cross the forest. The 
Book of Mormon is that reference, like a map, to return to our Heavenly 
Father. The book is it's own proof. Read it, meditate it and ask if it is 
true, cuz it either is or not true. :)
comments.author: YouMeandDaniel

comments.text:
I am in tears because my son fell away from all of the good things I tried 
to teach him. He's 19 and I wanted him to go on a mission to bring truth to 
the world. This is the Lord's work and I testify of that. But the story is 
not over for my son because this work is true and he will see it one day. 
My heart will not fail me because I trust in the strong arm of God. I am 
thankful to the missionaries and pray that if you are an investigator 
you'll listen and feel the Spirit of God as they teach.
comments.author: daffodilfleur

comments.text:
It's about truth. God accepts what is good and right from any people or any 
culture. He loves everyone and wants the best for everyone, but people are 
allowed to choose for themselves.. I agree that finding God is a personal 
experience but Christ said "I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man 
cometh unto the Father, but by me." John 14:6. While all religions probably 
have good parts about them, what Christ taught was a fulness of truth.
comments.author: Nate Maudsley

comments.text: This is one of my favorite mormon messages.
comments.author: Maria Paz Rivera

comments.text:
How can you all be so blinded? How is it possible that you have let your 
own pride and teachers preach falsities. The church us true and Russel M. 
Nelson is an apostle.
comments.author: Frankly1337

comments.text:
Many cultures many different believes, Yes Mormons have a different way, 
catholic has different ways, muslims ect. But if you think about it, there 
is only One Creator, if He made man with all these different cultures why 
would He not accept all these different ways as well?. In the end its all 
about finding God in you're own way.
comments.author: Smiggles van dort

comments.text:
I believe in Jesus Christ. I know he is my Savior. I have read the New 
Testament.. and the Old testament, and I believe them to be the word of 
God. These men are not coming between me and Christ, they are helping me 
come closer to Him.
comments.author: Alice Moses

comments.text:
I am not scared to die. I don't want to die yet. There is so much to live 
for and so much to do. But I am not scared to die. I am however scared of 
HOW I die. Being stoned to death as the early christians were or cruzified 
ect - those are very painful ways to go. I should think they were scared to 
death (pardon the pun). I'd hate to die of cancer like my granddad did - 
slowly and painfully dragged out for years... But death itself holds no 
fears for me.
comments.author: Aubergine1941

comments.text:
It is possible to be calm. The Holy Ghost is the comforter. Elder Nelson 
was a heart surgeon by profession. He's seen death occur. If a certain set 
of circumstances presents, it is inevitable. Death is simply the separation 
of the spirit and the body. Elder Nelson could feel the Holy Ghost. He has 
the faith to live his life with an attitude of "Thy will be done". So it is 
possible not to fear. May we all strive to acquire the same degree of faith.
comments.author: scienceteacher55
